overview_of_class:
This class explores the unaccompanied solo string works of JS Bach; the emphasis is on works for violin and cello, although some lute compositions may be studied also. Primary topics include musical structure-especially rhythm (grouping, metric, and surface) and implied counterpoint-and musical expression and interpretation.

Each class meeting will involve analysis and discussion of individual pieces, mostly led by student presenters. At-home analysis of the pieces chosen for class discussion will be the primary daily workload. In addition, each student will write a final project (7-10pp) on two movements.

Grades will be calculated on homework (60%), final project (30%), and class participation (10%).
name: Topics in Advanced Analysis
topic: Unaccompanied String Music of JS Bach
